ncertChapterName: Strategies for Enhancement in Food Production

questions.question: IR-8 is a high-yielding variety of:
questions.explanation: IR-8 is a semi-dwarf, high-yielding rice variety developed at IRRI (International Rice Research Institute), Philippines. It was introduced in India during Green Revolution and called 'miracle rice'.

questions.question: The main steps in plant breeding are:
questions.explanation: Plant breeding steps: 1) Collection of variability (germplasm), 2) Evaluation and selection of parents, 3) Cross hybridization, 4) Selection of superior recombinants, 5) Testing, release and commercialization.

questions.question: The hormone that promotes root formation in tissue culture is:
questions.explanation: Auxins promote root formation in tissue culture. The ratio of auxin to cytokinin determines organogenesis - high auxin favors roots, high cytokinin favors shoots, balanced ratio produces callus.

questions.question: Atlas 66 wheat variety is bred for:
questions.explanation: Atlas 66 wheat variety was bred for high protein content. Biofortified crops like this help address protein malnutrition in populations dependent on cereals as staple food.

questions.question: White revolution is associated with:
questions.explanation: White revolution (Operation Flood) refers to rapid increase in milk production in India. Dr. Verghese Kurien is called 'Father of White Revolution'. It made India largest milk producer.

questions.question: Heterosis or hybrid vigor refers to:
options: Superior performance of hybrid offspring than parents
questions.explanation: Heterosis (hybrid vigor) is the superior performance of hybrid offspring compared to either parent. It results from combination of best alleles from both parents and is exploited in breeding programs.

questions.question: Meristem culture is used for:
questions.explanation: Meristem (shoot tip) culture is used to produce virus-free plants. Meristem tissue usually lacks viruses as vascular tissue (through which viruses spread) is absent in meristem region.

questions.question: Integrated pest management (IPM) involves:
options: Combined use of biological, cultural, and minimal chemical control
questions.explanation: IPM combines biological control (biocontrol agents, predators), cultural practices (crop rotation, resistant varieties), and minimum chemical control for sustainable pest management with less environmental damage.

questions.question: Which of the following is an advantage of micropropagation?
options: Produces genetically identical plants in large numbers
questions.explanation: Advantages of micropropagation: rapid multiplication, production of genetically identical (true-to-type) plants, disease-free plants, conservation of rare species, year-round production, small space needed.

questions.question: Methylophilus methylotrophus is:
options: A yeast used for alcohol production
A bacterium used for producing SCP from methanol
questions.explanation: Methylophilus methylotrophus is a bacterium that can use methanol as sole carbon source to produce large amounts of protein-rich biomass. 250g of this organism can produce 25 tonnes of protein.

questions.question: Golden rice has been developed for:
questions.explanation: Golden rice is genetically modified rice that produces beta-carotene (provitamin A) in the grain. It was developed to address vitamin A deficiency, which causes blindness in millions of children.

questions.question: Blue revolution refers to:
questions.explanation: Blue revolution refers to the rapid growth in fish and aquatic food production through modern techniques of aquaculture. It is similar to green revolution in agriculture and white revolution in dairy.

questions.question: Layers in poultry are birds that:
questions.explanation: Layers are poultry birds (usually hens) specifically bred and raised for egg production. They are different from broilers which are raised for meat. Layers produce eggs for 18-24 months.

questions.question: Which of the following is a surface feeder in composite fish culture?
questions.explanation: Catla is a surface feeder. In composite fish culture: Catla feeds at surface, Rohu in middle column, Mrigal and Common carp at bottom, Grass carp on vegetation. This maximizes pond productivity.

questions.question: MOET stands for:
questions.explanation: MOET (Multiple Ovulation Embryo Transfer) is a technique to increase herd size rapidly. High-yielding cows are induced to produce many eggs, fertilized in vitro, and embryos transferred to surrogate mothers.

questions.question: Mung bean variety resistant to yellow mosaic virus and powdery mildew is:
questions.explanation: Pusa Komal is a cowpea variety resistant to bacterial blight. Actually, the mung bean variety resistant to yellow mosaic virus is created through mutation breeding.

questions.question: Explant in tissue culture is:
options: Any part of plant used to start culture
questions.explanation: Explant is any part of plant (leaf, stem, root tip, meristem, etc.) used to initiate tissue culture. The explant cells divide and form callus, which can be differentiated into complete plantlets.

questions.question: Protoplasts are:
options: Naked plant cells without cell wall
questions.explanation: Protoplasts are plant cells from which cell wall has been removed using enzymes (cellulase, pectinase). They are used in somatic hybridization as they can fuse with protoplasts of other species.

questions.question: Pusa Sadabahar is a chilli variety resistant to:
options: Chilli mosaic virus, leaf curl, and tobacco mosaic virus
questions.explanation: Pusa Sadabahar is a chilli variety developed for resistance to chilli mosaic virus, leaf curl, and tobacco mosaic virus. Disease-resistant varieties reduce pesticide use and crop losses.

questions.question: Germplasm collection refers to:
options: Entire collection of plants/seeds with all diverse alleles for all genes
questions.explanation: Germplasm refers to the entire collection of plants, seeds, and tissues that possess all the diverse alleles for all genes in a given crop. It is the source of genetic variability for breeding programs.

questions.question: Inbreeding in animal husbandry refers to:
questions.explanation: Inbreeding is mating between closely related animals (4-6 generations). It increases homozygosity and can be used to develop pure lines. However, it can also lead to inbreeding depression.

questions.question: Which of the following is a bottom feeder in composite fish culture?
questions.explanation: Mrigal and Common carp are bottom feeders that feed on detritus and organic matter at pond bottom. This feeding pattern allows efficient utilization of all pond zones in composite fish culture.

questions.question: The high-yielding exotic cattle breed developed for milk production is:
questions.explanation: Jersey is a high-yielding exotic cattle breed known for rich, creamy milk. Exotic breeds like Jersey and Holstein-Friesian give more milk than Indian breeds like Red Sindhi, Sahiwal, and Gir.

questions.question: Somatic hybridization involves:
options: Fusion of protoplasts from different plant species
questions.explanation: Somatic hybridization involves fusion of protoplasts (cell wall-removed cells) from two different plant species to create hybrid cells. This overcomes sexual incompatibility barriers between species.

questions.question: In poultry farming, broilers are:
questions.explanation: Broilers are chickens bred and raised specifically for meat production. They grow rapidly and have high feed-to-meat conversion ratio. Layers are birds raised for egg production.

questions.question: Totipotency refers to:
options: Ability of a cell to develop into a complete organism
questions.explanation: Totipotency is the ability of a single cell to divide and produce all differentiated cells of an organism (develop into complete organism). Plant cells retain totipotency, enabling tissue culture.

questions.question: The process of crossing genetically dissimilar plants to produce hybrids is called:
questions.explanation: Hybridization is the crossing of two genetically different plants to combine desirable characters from both parents into the offspring. It is the most commonly used method in plant breeding.

questions.question: Pusa Gaurav is a variety of:
questions.explanation: Pusa Gaurav is a mustard (Brassica) variety that is resistant to aphids (insect pests). Breeding pest-resistant varieties reduces the need for chemical pesticides.

questions.question: Apis dorsata is commonly known as:
questions.explanation: Apis dorsata is called rock bee or giant honey bee. It builds large single-comb nests on high branches or cliffs. It produces large quantities of honey but is aggressive and cannot be domesticated easily.

questions.question: Pusa Swarnim is a variety of Brassica that is resistant to:
questions.explanation: Pusa Swarnim is a mustard (Brassica) variety developed at IARI that is resistant to white rust disease. Such disease-resistant varieties help in reducing crop losses.

questions.question: Fisheries is a sector that deals with:
options: Both freshwater and marine fish as well as other aquatic organisms
questions.explanation: Fisheries involves catching, breeding, and management of fish and other aquatic organisms (prawns, crabs, oysters, etc.) from both freshwater (ponds, rivers) and marine (sea) sources.

questions.question: The most commonly used bee species for commercial honey production is:
questions.explanation: Apis mellifera (Italian bee) is most commonly used for commercial honey production. It is gentle, has good honey yield, and can be easily maintained in artificial hives.

questions.question: Tissue culture technique involves:
options: Growing plant cells/tissues in artificial nutrient medium under aseptic conditions
questions.explanation: Plant tissue culture involves growing plant cells, tissues, or organs in artificial nutrient medium under aseptic (sterile) conditions. It is used for rapid multiplication and production of disease-free plants.

questions.question: Dairy farm management includes:
options: Quality and quantity of milk production
Proper housing, feeding, and disease control
questions.explanation: Dairy farm management involves multiple aspects: selection of high-yielding breeds, proper housing and feeding, hygiene, regular health inspection, disease control, and maintaining milk quality and quantity.

questions.question: Maize hybrids with high lysine and tryptophan are developed to:
questions.explanation: Maize hybrids with high lysine and tryptophan (essential amino acids usually deficient in cereals) are biofortified varieties that improve protein quality for better human nutrition.

questions.question: The Nobel Peace Prize winner for developing high-yielding wheat varieties was:
questions.explanation: Norman E. Borlaug won the Nobel Peace Prize in 1970 for developing high-yielding, disease-resistant wheat varieties. He is called 'Father of Green Revolution' globally.

questions.question: Micropropagation is used for:
options: Rapid multiplication of plants from small tissue pieces
questions.explanation: Micropropagation is the rapid multiplication of plants through tissue culture. Thousands of plantlets can be produced from a small explant in a short time. It's used for commercial propagation.

questions.question: Hisardale sheep is a cross between:
questions.explanation: Hisardale sheep is a new breed developed by crossing Bikaneri ewes with Merino rams. It combines good wool quality of Merino with adaptability of Bikaneri to Indian conditions.

questions.question: Plants produced through tissue culture are called:
questions.explanation: Plants produced through tissue culture from a single parent are called somaclones. They are genetically identical to parent. Sometimes somaclonal variations (genetic variations) may occur during culture.

questions.question: Biofortification refers to:
options: Adding vitamins to food during processing
Breeding crops with higher nutritional quality
questions.explanation: Biofortification is breeding crops with higher levels of vitamins, minerals, and proteins. Examples: Golden rice (beta-carotene), iron-fortified rice, protein-rich maize. It addresses malnutrition.

questions.question: Sonalika and Kalyan Sona are varieties of:
questions.explanation: Sonalika and Kalyan Sona are high-yielding, semi-dwarf wheat varieties developed in India during Green Revolution. They are resistant to rust diseases and give high yields with irrigation and fertilizers.

questions.question: Rohu is a:
questions.explanation: Rohu (Labeo rohita) is a column feeder that feeds in the middle zone of water on plant material. It is one of the major carps used in composite fish culture in India.

questions.question: Plant breeding is defined as:
options: Purposeful manipulation of plant species for desired characteristics
questions.explanation: Plant breeding is the purposeful manipulation of plant species to create desired plant types that are better suited for cultivation, produce better yields, and are disease resistant.

questions.question: Green manure crops are:
options: Crops grown and ploughed into soil for soil enrichment
questions.explanation: Green manure crops (like sun hemp, Sesbania) are grown and ploughed into soil while green. They add organic matter and nitrogen (if leguminous) to soil, improving soil fertility naturally.

questions.question: Jaya and Ratna are high-yielding varieties of:
questions.explanation: Jaya and Ratna are high-yielding rice varieties developed in India. Jaya is a cross between T(N)1 and T-141, known for high yield potential.

questions.question: Grass carp in composite fish culture feeds on:
questions.explanation: Grass carp (Ctenopharyngodon idella) feeds on aquatic weeds and vegetation. It helps control weed growth in ponds while converting plant matter to fish protein.

questions.question: The hormone that promotes shoot formation in tissue culture is:
questions.explanation: Cytokinins promote shoot formation in tissue culture. High cytokinin to auxin ratio promotes shoot development, while high auxin to cytokinin ratio promotes root development.

questions.question: The enzyme used to remove cell wall for protoplast isolation is:
questions.explanation: Cellulase (digests cellulose) and pectinase (digests pectin) enzymes are used to remove cell wall and isolate protoplasts. The protoplasts are osmotically fragile and need proper medium.

questions.question: The mule is an example of:
questions.explanation: Mule (male donkey Ã— female horse) is an example of interspecific hybridization. It combines strength and patience of donkey with size and speed of horse. Mules are usually sterile.

questions.question: Apiculture is:
questions.explanation: Apiculture is bee-keeping for production of honey and beeswax. Common species include Apis indica, Apis dorsata (rock bee), Apis florea (little bee), and Apis mellifera (Italian bee).

questions.question: Artificial insemination involves:
options: Injecting semen collected from superior male into female
questions.explanation: Artificial insemination is introducing semen collected from superior males into reproductive tract of selected females. It allows one superior male to mate many females and spread superior genes.

questions.question: Himgiri is a wheat variety resistant to:
options: Hill bunt, leaf rust, and stripe rust
questions.explanation: Himgiri is a disease-resistant wheat variety developed in India. It is resistant to hill bunt, leaf rust, and stripe rust - common fungal diseases affecting wheat crops.

questions.question: Saccharum officinarum is crossed with wild species for:
options: Disease resistance, better ratooning, high yield
questions.explanation: Saccharum officinarum (noble cane, high sugar) is crossed with Saccharum barberi (north Indian wild cane) for disease resistance, tolerance to stress, good ratooning ability, and high yield.

questions.question: Pusa Sem 2 and Pusa Sem 3 are varieties of:
options: Flat bean resistant to jassids, aphids, and fruit borer
questions.explanation: Pusa Sem 2 and Pusa Sem 3 are flat bean (sem) varieties bred for resistance to jassids, aphids, and fruit borer. Pest-resistant varieties provide natural crop protection.

questions.question: The 'Father of White Revolution in India' is:
questions.explanation: Dr. Verghese Kurien is called the 'Father of White Revolution in India'. He founded Amul dairy cooperative and led Operation Flood, which transformed India into world's largest milk producer.

questions.question: Composite fish culture involves:
options: Culturing multiple compatible fish species in same pond
questions.explanation: Composite fish culture (polyculture) involves growing 5-6 compatible fish species in the same pond to utilize all ecological niches. Surface feeders, column feeders, and bottom feeders are combined.

questions.question: Pomato is a somatic hybrid of:
questions.explanation: Pomato is a somatic hybrid produced by fusing protoplasts of potato and tomato. While scientifically interesting, such hybrids are often sterile or don't combine the useful traits of both parents.

questions.question: Aquaculture refers to:
options: Culture of aquatic organisms under controlled conditions
questions.explanation: Aquaculture is the farming of aquatic organisms (fish, shellfish, aquatic plants) under controlled conditions. It includes both freshwater aquaculture and mariculture (marine aquaculture).

questions.question: Semi-dwarf wheat varieties were developed from:
questions.explanation: Semi-dwarf wheat varieties were developed using Japanese variety Norin 10 which carried dwarfing genes. These short, high-yielding varieties don't lodge and respond well to fertilizers.

questions.question: Animal husbandry deals with:
options: Care, breeding and management of livestock
questions.explanation: Animal husbandry is the agricultural practice dealing with care, breeding, and management of livestock animals for commercial purposes. It includes dairy farming, poultry, bee-keeping, and fisheries.

questions.question: Outbreeding refers to:
options: Mating of unrelated animals of same breed or different breeds
questions.explanation: Outbreeding is mating between unrelated animals. It includes out-crossing (same breed, no common ancestor for 4-6 generations), cross-breeding (different breeds), and interspecific hybridization.

questions.question: Callus is:
questions.explanation: Callus is an unorganized, undifferentiated mass of cells produced when plant tissue is cultured on appropriate medium with hormones. Callus can be induced to form roots and shoots.

questions.question: Single Cell Protein (SCP) refers to:
options: Protein from a single plant cell
Microbial biomass used as protein-rich food/feed
questions.explanation: Single Cell Protein (SCP) is protein-rich microbial biomass from bacteria, yeasts, algae, or fungi. It can be used as food for humans or animal feed. Spirulina, Methylophilus are SCP sources.

questions.question: Spirulina is:
options: A blue-green alga (cyanobacterium) used for SCP
questions.explanation: Spirulina is a blue-green alga (cyanobacterium) rich in proteins, vitamins, and minerals. It is used as a nutritional supplement and as single cell protein. It can grow on waste water.

questions.question: Mutation breeding involves:
questions.explanation: Mutation breeding uses physical (radiation) or chemical mutagens to induce genetic variations. Desirable mutants are selected and used as new varieties or in hybridization programs.

questions.question: The 'Father of Green Revolution in India' is:
questions.explanation: Dr. M.S. Swaminathan is called the 'Father of Green Revolution in India'. He introduced Mexican semi-dwarf wheat varieties to India and developed many high-yielding varieties.
